CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 19, 1951, pg. 17, reads: "West Virginia Artists Win National Honors - Samuel Chappelle and Gordon Beverly won second place and honorable mention, respectively, for these offerings at the National Scholastic Art Exhibit at Carnegie Museum here last week in a competition exhibiting 1,000 pieced of work by students who had won prizes previously in state scholastic contests throughout the nation. Chappelle was four times 'key' winner on the state level in West Virginia, and Beverly was twice 'key' winner in same state. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Art award winners Samuel Chappelle holding camera, and Gordon Beverly, posed in front of display of watercolor paintings, at National Scholastic Art Exhibition, Carnegie Museum of Art
